intro: Stenandriopsis gabonica, commonly known as the Gabon flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces woody capsules as its fruit. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland and montane forest areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
